displaytitle: Appliqués in the form of lions' heads and a roundel with heraldic lions
dimensions:
each lion head: h. 5.7 cm., w. 4.9 cm. (2 1/4 x 1 15/16 in.), wt. 8.7g 
roundrel: diam. 5.3 cm. (2 1/16 in.), wt. 12. 4 g.
creditline: Museum purchase, Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr., Memorial Collection

geography.displaygeography: Place made: Iran, possibly Ecbatana (modern day Hamadan)

caption: Iranian, Achaemenid Persian Period (ca. 550–330 BCE), possibly Ecbatana (modern day Hamadan), Iran, late 5th – early 4th century B.C., Appliqués in the form of lions' heads and a roundel with heraldic lions. Gold; 5.7 x 4.9 cm (each lion head), 5.3 cm., 12.4g (roundrel). Museum purchase, Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr., Memorial Collection (2002-379, 380, 381)
